content.description: Climb the less-than-vertical face on bands of horizontal ledges. Dodge the dead tree at the top!
content.location: The left-most side of The Stone Throne Wall. Just to the right of the small cave.

content.description: Climb the dihedral passing two roofs. The cracks below the roofs are nice/solid rock and accept pro well. The farther left and right you stray from the dihedral, the worse the rock quality becomes.
content.location: The dihedral on the far (climber's) right side of The Stone Throne wall.

content.description: Climb the overhanging face on positive ledges until you reach a wide band of orange rock (crux). Make a large move over the bulge, and continue on poor-quality rock to the top.
content.location: Overhanging face to the left of "Ned's Dead".

content.description:
The wall below the "Stone Throne" holds some fairly good (for Palo Duro Canyon) crack climbs as well as some overhanging face climbs with "good" horizontal pinches/ledges.  As with all rock in the canyon, the cliff varies in quality from absolute choss to decent sandstone. A good rule of thumb here is the darker the rock, the more solid (grey and orange/rust colored stuff is pretty trustworthy, the cream colored stuff will explode to dust in your hands).    There are many mesquite trees atop the cliff to build anchors on, just make sure to bring plenty of webbing! (50ft+) 

  DONT CLIMB HERE AFTER IT RAINS   I'd say to wait at least 3 days if not longer.  

  MAKE SURE YOUR ANCHORS HANG OVER THE CLIFF'S EDGE AND THAT YOUR ROPE DOESN"T RUN AGAINST THE ROCK   even the good rock here is pretty soft.
